title: Pretty good, very surprised
text: This is a pretty great alternative to Google Authenticator. And it adds backup capability that Google Authenticator frustratingly lacks. The only thing I’d wish for is for the countdown clocks to turn red or something when time is about to expire like gauth does. But, otherwise, this app is perfect.

title: Very buggy. Don’t understand how this is released as is
text:
Found this app to be very buggy. Sometimes number matching notifications just do not work and only resolution is to uninstall/reinstall app. Why can’t MS fix this app?

Also in no way do notifications work for iOS. I can’t understand if this is intentional design but forcing a user to manually open the Authenticator app is user hostile design and bad UX. Ms needs to do more to improve the sign in experience.

title: Watch link broken again
text: Suddenly unable to use my AppleWatch to authenticate again… It’s NEVER intuitive to try to figure out how to fix that broken connection! I get an alert on my watch, but all I can do is “dismiss” it! What good is that?! Sigh. Guess I’ll switch everything to Duo… it never has a problem working on my AppleWatch.

title: Bring Apple Watch Functionality Back!
text:
It didn’t work 100% of the time, but removing this functionality has been really frustrating.

I don’t always have my phone within reach and expediting the “Approve” process is important. 

I don’t know what your reasons were for removing it, but as long as they weren’t security related this feature worth the hassle.

title: You’ll regret it
text: This thing has my email messed up. I switched phones and was careful to switch all info and passwords to the new phone before resetting the original phone. Everything EXCEPT this app now works. It won’t sign it. I can’t use it but now my Microsoft outlook is linked to an app that doesn’t work. So I’m about to have to agree to 30 days of no access to my email, during tax season, in order to reset my password manually. Sorry I ever downloaded this thing.

title: Not backing up mfa qr accounts
text: Only thing that’s backed up as the passwords. I lost access to the phone and then we got a new phone and install the authenticator it’s missing all the MFA accounts. Even with the Microsoft account connected to it relinking to the account didn’t bring back all the QRAuthentications.   It was a huge problem and wasn’t able to log into many accounts for days

title: So much easier and faster
text: Just takes the multiple steps of security steps by using the app is great. Especially if you make your accounts a little to secure Authenticator just helps you add encryption for more security but easier for us users.

title: Recovery doesn’t work
text: If you lose your device, you can not recover even if you did backup your Authenticator using the iCloud backup feature.  Once recovered you have to rescan QR codes for every account you have entered… which you can’t do because you need MFA to get into any of them.  Pointless to have a backup of your Authenticator when recovery requires you to have a working Authenticator to do a full recovery.  Use this app with caution!!

title: Apple Watch companion app broken
text: I was happy with this until I bought an Apple Watch. Then I discovered that the companion app running on the Apple Watch is broken: most Authenticator requests approved there fail. So, instead of being a nice convenience, it instead sabotages the whole experience. I am deleting the companion app from my Apple Watch, but there’s no excuse for it being so badly broken.

title: It won’t go away
text: I was asked to download a specific app in. Order to complete access I needed. Despite typing the exact name of that app into the App Store search, this came up first. I downloaded it and started a free trial before I realized my mistake. All that is obviously my fault. What irritates me is there is no obvious way to cancel. The instructions I found say to go to Account Settings and disable auto-renew. Except I don’t see an auto-renew in the account settings.

title: Very solid app
text: This app is very well put together and works exactly how you’d need and want ur Authenticator app too work! The only thing that could be improved to get a 5 out of 5 is fix the problem which is app would freeze for a split second and

title: Worked well until iOS 14 update
text: The app still works well, however the watch approval for office 365 account approval has stopped working both for my business and for my personal 365 accounts. Both accounts show up on the phone and watch, and I get an alert on my watch to approve the login, however I get a message on my watch that “something has gone wrong”. I have removed both the App from my watch and my iPhone. Otherwise worked great to approve login!

title: Needs to coordinate updates with Outlook
text: Every single time I update my Outlook password (as required by my job), Authenticator stops working and I get an error message to contact support. And every single time we do the “turn it off/turn it back on, uninstall/reinstall” dance like it’s 1994. And EVERY SINGLE TIME, nothing works, they are bewildered... and suddenly an Authenticator update hits and it’s magically fixed. SO MYSTERIOUS. It’s the same company, it shouldn’t be this hard!

title: Great update
text: Before this update, when using 2 step verification and having to approve a sign in you would have to manually open the app to click approval, now the approval notification pops up instantly. Great app that keeps getting better

title: Please fix this issue
text: It’s a great app it’s reliable and always works but I have one issue with it I just got a new phone and signed in on the authenticator app and I didn’t transfer all my authentication codes

title: Great overall Authenticator
text: This is a great overall authenticator. However, I wish that you would be able to create groups for different codes. If you have a huge organization, then you might need to divide it up into groups, so please, Microsoft allow us to create groups within the authenticator.

title: Failed when it was needed for its purpose
text: I have had this app for years, in fact since it was newly released to the point where I was my Authenticator across the board. Issue now is my phone failed and had to switch devices. Being I used this app as 2F EVERYTHING goes to it and despite doing a backup. It ONLY restored one account which is outlook. So now I’m royal ly screwed, good and proper locked out of all my other accounts….thank you…lesson learnt

title: Super Simple
text: This app is extremely easy and simple to use.  I have had no issues with it at all.  And I also like the fact I can use apps that aren’t always just Google all the time, lol.

title: Apple Watch approve access not working
text: Hello.. after updating my iPhone and Apple Watch to the lates IOS now is not syncing when signing in . When I enter my email password then it shows the notification on my Apple Watch to approve and deny but after approving it doesn’t open my account . Only works if I approve from iPhone . Please help .

title: Almost Perfect
text:
iCloud backup is a nice addition, but it should go all in & allow the ability to sync to other devices (securely, of course — perhaps from a prompt on an already signed in device??).

Also would like to edit account names & photos.

Still, this is my favorite Authenticator App. Hoping for M1 Mac support!

title: Notifications not working anymore
text:
After the second to last IOS update for IPhone the app stopped sending notifications when there’s a new request for approval. 

I checked my notifications settings and the app doesn’t even show up in there to activate/desactívate. 

What happened?

title: Fustercluck
text:
I tried to love this app. I liked it clean and simple interface. I liked that it connected easily to my outlook account. 

I waited forever for a watch app. After a couple version testing the beta with no luck I think I’m in the clear once 12 comes out.. nope. Still won’t connect. Deleted Authenticator and moved over to OTP Auth where the watch app works flawlessly.

title: How did this build pass testing?
text: Want to have outlook talk to an app made by the same company so you can seamlessly access your secured email? Well this authenticator will request you sign in on its own app and not outlook so it can send a request to itself and then you never see the request because it’s screen is below your current screen. But if you leave your current screen, it will cancel the request.

title: Worst experience I’ve had with security
text: This app seems not to work I’m trying to sign in to a website for school, it sends number or whatever, the app shows nothing. It’s updated and just doesn’t want to work for me. I’ve been trying to get this to work for three hours. Well waisted going to contact my school to hopefully resolve this issue and to advise them to remove some services with this app or Microsoft company.

title: DO NOT USE THIS APP!
text: By far the absolute worst authentication app I have used. I got a new phone recently and upgraded to the 14 pro max, long behold I no longer can access my mass of accounts I had because they are such simpletons to not consider to transfer them over. I know have to go and individually contact each company and let them know I won’t make the same mistake of ever trusting microsoft again to actually know what they are doing.

title: DOES NOT BACKUP BY DEFAULT
text: I had to learn the hard way when I got a new phone today. I had made sure my phone, iCloud and device was backed up prior to making the switch. Turns out  MS Authenticator was disabled by default within the application, something I never considered to check or know. I hope this helps someone out there!

title: Utter garbage.
text: About a week and a half ago I denied a request for authentication so my work accounts were locked down (as a precaution and as expected), and ever since then this reeking pile of hot garbage has utterly stymied all attempts by myself and my employer’s IT department to regain access to my accounts on my mobile devices. The different strategies we have used are too many to go into here, on both phone and tablet, but they all end with “verification failed.” So thanks for that pain the a55 Microsoft.

title: Sometimes is not working, please advise.
text: Sometimes is not displaying the approval window after the login request sent to the phone. Also, the password option should be off once user selected the option to use please advise, or password should be combined with the Authentication app. Thanks

title: Mandatory and doesn’t work
text: Mandatory in order to use some of the Microsoft apps, even though they can easily be authenticated by phone number. it is a hassle to set up and the QR scanner doesn’t work. Microsoft always tries to make you use their apps and products until they realize it doesn’t work at all and then changes everything. It’s their constant way of losing money and clients.

title: thx
text: I lost my account before and some one tried to sign in to my account my account but they couldn’t I  got a message about and I changed my password and email

title: Ridiculously Difficult
text: The stupid of this app is unfathomable. No matter how many times I authenticate from the same device it still demands authentication making signing IMPOSSIBLE!!! It is for that reason I avoid using any of the Microsoft products.  The positive reviews are nothing more than fluff, and probably paid for. This is a useless tool and a useless product. Seriously, Billy boy, you need to fire your entire IT department.

title: Uninstalled, as it asked to share my/user's data !!
text: Strangely, this MS app says, unless user / i share data, user / i cannot use it !! Uninstalled it. Another strange thing is, it provides only two options: [Accept] button to allow it to spy/steal data, or [Decline] button to decline the option !! Why is it "Decline" ? it should be [Decline & Uninstall] ... that wud make uninstallation easy. Or it can display a [Uninstall] button immediately after pressing [Decline].

title: Locked out of my account
text: So I used to use the Authenticator app but when I got a new phone because my old one broke I got a new number and I tried to login but is would not work because the “use my app” doesn’t work and because I changed phones the “text ************* number” doesn’t work either. Also it won’t let me make a new account. So basically I all banned for the Authenticator app. Is there a way to fix it?

title: Trash
text: Fails to work properly, had to reset 2FA, twice. Then won’t scan QR codes for additional accounts without overwriting the first. A problem known and discussed, but “solved” with a link to a “solution” that isn’t—because that link addresses a completely different problem. Everything you can possibly hate about Microsoft is condensed in this app in a nutshell. Deleted and replaced it with an authenticator app that actually works.

title: Love this app
text: This app is real dope. I have never had anything wrong with it. I have a my system information on them and always keep it safe it’s a 10/10 app. I have had this app for 6 years now

title: Not friendly to elderly.
text:
I signed up for a new email address, and could not get past your antiquated , captcha program. I’m elderly and slower than I use to be because my eye site is growing dem. 

The pictures you show are dark, dim and fuzzy. This is modern day, we use computers. Aren’t there any better ways to run your business? Every day is a hassle because you don’t understand your older clients needs. 

Eighty % of us are the major population with the most buying power.

title: Doesn’t tell everything
text: I let a family member use my account on their Xbox and this app only tells me when I sign in on my phone, not when they sign in every day. I’m concerned what this means about other devices that I potentially may not be aware of

title: Hidden cost of use
text:
It is free, yet expensive, and that it tracks and drives information. Despite this Microsoft has without a doubt one of the most obtuse login workflows I have seen date. Utilizes complexity as a security feature at the cost of usability to the point that when one thing goes wrong, you are waiting 30 days to get back in to any account.

I can’t good conscience with so many other alternatives out there.

title: Easy to use
text: I’ve really been enjoying this app. makes two factor authentication a lot easier. Scanning qr-codes easily gets information into the system.

title: Counterintuitive
text:
Actually unusable. I have it for my work email and if you open Microsoft mail, it takes you straight to the app. 

In the Authenticator app, it says to open the Authenticator app and input numbers… but you can’t because the numbers it’s showing you is in the app, and does not allow you to put in numbers….

I’m stumped on how I’m supposed to use it

title: Battery drain
text:
Recently, while the app is open it drains the battery extremely fast and the phone gets warm to the touch. 

I had the app open for about 10 minutes this morning and it drained 25% battery! 

I have now reported this from the in app feedback twice. Please fix this stat!

title: Would have been 5 star
text: Easily would have been 5 star but you took it off my watch. As a tech admin for a school district I’m constantly adding computers/laptops and have to authenticate many times a day, and it’s so much easier when I can just tap it on my watch because I don’t always have my phone out or able to get to it as fast. Please bring it back for my watch and I’ll gladly change to 5 star.

title: Fix the Watch problem!
text: My company requires me to use this to do ANYTHING, and my job (educator) requires that I move nimbly from computer to computer, slogging through the same ridiculously long and complex authentication process over and over. The Watch interface made it tolerable. I could leave my phone in my office and still get logged on in every classroom. Now we go backwards again. So frustrating and stupid.

title: Buggy
text: Last few updates have been buggy.  I have an  iPhone Xs with the latest iOS and the app often freezes and fails to load.

title: A MUST HAVE security solution for EVERYONE!
text: I love this Authenticator. Only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that I recently switched my devices and getting my with tokens transferred to a new device is all manual process. Please brainstorm and find a way of securely transferring this setup to a new device.

title: Super secure
text:
Don’t ever worry about anyone breaking into your account!

In fact, you won’t even be able to log into your own email!

This piece of junk (no surprise, just like most other Microsoft products) not only locked me out of my email, but I am currently missing deadlines while waiting on “support” staff to find a solution. Easy solution. I have a password that I created to securely log into my email. Maybe, just maybe, that should give me access to what I have paid good money for!

False.

Microsoft has its head shoved so far up its own behind that they can’t even provide email service without screwing the pooch.

Way to go Bill!

How this piece of junk has 4.8 stars is beyond me. This provides no better security than Apple’s keychain.

title: Words in left top corner
text: Change the color of the words in the left corner that allows you to switch back to the previous app.

title: WORST!!!!!
text:
Microsoft is terrible with their privacy and their password. They make it so difficult for you to login somethings so simple and it doesn’t let you recover anything after it doesn’t let you login. Microsoft is the worst company ever

And the stupid thing is is that it wants me to verify on the authentication app (this) when im on this app trying to log in after I put my password correct. Even after I put it it wants me to verify. Nothing has ever made me more frustrated

title: Backups unreliable!!!
text: I had an iCloud backup setup. But I was having trouble accessing my outlook account when I got a new phone. So I went into settings and trying to get the backup by turning on backups but that created a new backup and erased my actual backup from my old phone! And there was no way to access the old back up. So now I have to remember which services I was using 2FA with and go through the painful process of resetting all of them again!!! Argh Microsoft!!!

title: Doesn’t do what it’s supposed to
text: When I try to login from my computer or even my phone, this app is supposed to pop open with a 2-digit number that I type to verify it’s me. This rarely happens. As a result I have to take several additional steps to be able to read my email. My work started requiring this a few months ago and it has made accessing email significantly harder.
